divs: sighting detailsat about 8:50pm on the evening of 4\29\10, i went into the kitchen to help my 14year old son make his school lunch for his field trip the next day..i went over to the living room window to close the blinds when i looked up into the sky and noticed how clear the night sky was, so i went out the back door to look up at the stars, because as of late me and my boys have been noticing and filming lots of moving stars..we understand some of them might be satalites and space junk, but most of them are zig zagging and tranversing the sky from east to west from north to south and back again, within a 20 minute time span we counted nine unusual star like objects on 4\7\10 at about 8:30pm, and as i was standing there waiting to see more, two balls of light came over the townhome that we live in, and shot across the sky and disappeared over the tree tops...on this night (4\29\10) as i looked up i noticed, comming from the s.w, a bright star like object, but this one was different, it was lower in the sky, and moved really slow, i was upset that i did't bring out my camcorder to film what i was seeing, all i could do was call out to my 14yr old son aaron, who came outside and we stood there in awe, not knowing what we were looking at...as it came over us my son said "dad, it's a triangle" with a red light in front" sure enough we both could make out a silhouette of a triangle, but with only one star like light in the middle, and a small red light at the front end of the thing...we both called out for my other boys, christopher 15yrs, derek 10yrs and nicholas 7yrs old, they all came outside and saw what we were looking at, eventually it went out of sight over the tree line heading n.e, we were all pretty excited at what we saw..i myself have seen these low flying star like objects in the past, they silently transverse the night sky over greeley, fort collins, and now here in loveland colorado hopefully one day i can figure out what they are.....
Summary: Me and my 4 boys observed a star like object transverse the sky...
